titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 622: L'arbre des batailles

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Ms. Codex 622: L'arbre des batailles are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

Metadata is © and licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution License version 4.0 (CC-BY-4.0 https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/legalcode. For a description of the terms of use see the Creative Commons Deed https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/.

notesStmt.note: "Manuscrit de 1446" written on 19th-century endleaf and on small portion of former binding now attached to spine of 19th-century binding.
Notes in a later hand on final folio attribute work to Honoré Bonnor; same attribution is on spine.
Some water damage, upper outer corner of first portion; first two leaves have been repaired.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: A treatise on war in four parts.

supportDesc.extent: 127 leaves : 200 x 134 (145 x 94) mm. bound to 206 x 137 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, ii (modern paper) + 127 + ii (modern paper); [1-127]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 23-25 long lines; ruled in ink.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a Gothic cursive script by a single hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Rubricated headings and initials throughout; some initials decorated with faces (f. 2r, 7v, 8r).

origin.p: Written in France[?], in the 15th century.

history.provenance: George Poulin (ca. 1500); Alexandre de Keller (19th century).

keywords.term: Military art and science--Early works to 1800
